data.text: @youwokedad Depends when you test and how you test etc, but if others had it then your 4yo had it too:may have had it twice in this case. Tests aren't always the be all end all. If it quacks like a duck...

@EnemyInAState Curious.   My 4yo had croup like illness beginning of Dec, even had the seal cough, had to give steroids seemed to get better.   In Jan had same symptoms, but less pronounced bark.    Both times tested neg for Covid, but after Jan illness Covid ripped thru everyone else in house

We've been reporting it for months...

https://t.co/rS39E4vpb3
@EnemyInAState Acute kidney failure - I wonder if it’s clotting in the renal arteries.
'We’re seeing an increase in hospitalizations; we’re seeing our patients under 4 years old have croup-like symptoms, requiring either steroids or breathing treatments to help them to breathe.”

'Everyone was saying it was a mild variant, as well. Interestingly, that’s not necessarily what we’re seeing in pediatrics'

Actually, not EVERYONE was saying that. https://t.co/GYBhrdaRtP

'This is becoming an increasingly worrisome state for our pediatric patients,” said Dr. John Lukeman, Warren Clinic pediatrician, in a COVID-19 response update Monday afternoon.' https://t.co/4MXgHawpRP
